title: Apfelkuchen (Apple Cake)
description: This traditional German apple cake, Apfelkuchen, is a delightful blend of tender yeast dough topped with juicy apples and a fragrant crumbly streusel. Its warm cinnamon and nutmeg notes make it a comforting dessert perfect for cozy gatherings or a sweet treat any time of year.
ingredients: 3 large apples - peeled, cored, and sliced
instructions: Grease the bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch baking dish or a 9-inch springform pan.
In a large bowl, beat 2 ¼ cups flour, warm milk, ¼ cup sugar, yeast, softened butter, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt with an electric mixer on high until the dough is smooth, about 5 minutes.
Spread the dough evenly into the prepared baking dish, pressing it up the sides.
Press the peeled, cored, and sliced apples evenly into the dough.
In a separate bowl, mix 1 cup sugar, ¾ cup flour, candied lemon peel (if using), cinnamon, nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
Cut in ½ cup butter with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle the crumb mixture evenly over the apples.
Allow the dough to rise for 30 minutes in a warm place.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Bake the cake in the preheated oven until golden brown and the apples are tender, about 35 minutes.
tips: For a perfectly tender dough, ensure your milk is warm but not hot to activate the yeast properly. Avoid overmixing the crumb topping to keep it light and crumbly. Let the cake cool slightly before slicing to allow the flavors to meld and the texture to set.

structured_content.content: Apfelkuchen is a beloved German apple cake that combines a soft, yeasted dough with a sweet and spiced apple topping, crowned by a buttery crumb streusel. Its inviting aroma of cinnamon and nutmeg fills the kitchen, making it a truly special dessert that evokes warmth and nostalgia.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour 25 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners, entertaining, and special events
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • A nostalgic treat that brings comforting memories with every bite

structured_content.content: I first tasted Apfelkuchen in sixth grade during a special treat from a German bakery ordered by my teacher. The sweet, tender apples and crumbly topping instantly captured my heart, making it a dessert I cherish to this day.

• Main ingredient: Fresh, crisp apples work best for a balance of tartness and sweetness; peel, core, and slice evenly for uniform baking.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Ground cinnamon and nutmeg add warm, aromatic spice; choose fresh spices for maximum flavor.
  • Supporting ingredients: Candied lemon peel adds a subtle citrus brightness but is optional; softened butter ensures a tender dough and crumb topping.
  • Equipment needed: Electric mixer for smooth dough, 9x13-inch baking dish or 9-inch springform pan, pastry blender or knife for crumb topping.

Preparation:
Beat the dough ingredients until smooth, then spread into the greased pan and press apples into the surface. Prepare the crumb topping by mixing dry ingredients and cutting in butter.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Sprinkle the crumb topping over the apples, allow the dough to rise for 30 minutes, then bake at 400°F (200°C) until golden and apples are tender, about 35 minutes.
Finishing Touches:
Let the cake cool slightly before serving to enhance flavor and texture. Serve warm or at room temperature, optionally with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use warm milk to activate yeast without killing it
  • Don’t skip the rising time to ensure a light, fluffy dough
  • Look for a golden crust and tender apples as signs the cake is done
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate; reheat gently before serving

structured_content.content: Sharing Apfelkuchen with family always brings smiles and stories of childhood memories, making it more than just a dessert but a cherished tradition.

Enhance the cake by adding a splash of rum or apple brandy to the dough, or sprinkle chopped toasted almonds on top of the crumb for extra crunch and nuttiness. Fresh lemon zest in the crumb topping can brighten the flavors beautifully.

Serve Apfelkuchen with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream for a classic pairing. It also pairs wonderfully with a hot cup of coffee or spiced tea, making it ideal for afternoon gatherings or holiday celebrations.

For a gluten-free version, substitute the flour with a gluten-free baking blend. Vegan adaptations can be made by using plant-based milk and butter alternatives, and replacing the egg with a flaxseed egg if desired. Adding pears or berries alongside apples offers a fresh twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Beat the dough thoroughly for a smooth, elastic texture
  • Use softened butter for easy incorporation into dough and crumb topping
  • Allow the dough to rise in a warm, draft-free spot for best results
  • Press apples evenly into dough to ensure consistent baking and flavor distribution

structured_content.content: With this Apfelkuchen recipe, you’re set to create a delicious, heartwarming dessert that brings joy and comfort to your table. Embrace the process, enjoy the aromas, and savor every bite of this timeless classic.
